TaxonIdentification.species_name: 根足薹草 gen zu tai cao

treatment.description: Rhizome thick, elongate, covered with fibrous, brown remains of leaf sheath. Culms 30–60 cm tall, soft, trigonous, scabrid on angles. Leaves herbaceous, soft, shorter than culm, blades 2–4 mm wide, flat, margins scabrid. Inflorescence 1-spiked, terminal, androgynous, erect, linear-cylindric, 40–70 × 2–3 mm, bractless; male part very short, 3–5-flowered; female part loosely flowered, sometimes lowermost 2 flowers 1–2 cm apart from each other. Female glumes pale brown laterally, ovate-lanceolate to oblong-lanceolate, 4–5 mm, green costa 3-veined, apex acute to mucronate, or lower glumes shortly awned. Utricles longer than glume, erect, lanceolate, trigonous, ca. 6 mm (including beak), herbaceous, glabrous, abaxially distinctly slenderly many veined, apex abruptly contracted into a subcylindric beak 2–3 mm, orifice distinctly shortly 2-toothed, teeth acute. Nutlet obovate, ca. 2.5 mm, crowned with slightly recurved beak; stigmas 3.
